channel.title: Posts on CSE Thesis Musings
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on CSE Thesis Musings

item.title: Project Focus
item.description: Software Security Flaws in the protocol (i.e. confidentiality, exploits) Firmware How long can the wifi ssid/password be :) Privacy What data is being transmitted Sensors - what can it see? What data is stored on the device Does that data get cleared during a reset?

item.title: Report A Preparation
item.description: Literature Review (50%) Distinction -> Is the student showing that they understand the conceptual relationships between the different reviewed works. The most significant areas of literature relevant to the proposed work have been reviewed and the student has clearly identified one or more knowledge gaps.

item.title: Seminar A Preparation
item.description: Criterion Make a 30-minute presentation about your Thesis A topic and the plan The talk presents an extensive, logically organised review, analysis and discussion of background material. Demonstrates clear mastery of the material in the topic area already. A clearly articulated definition of the problem and/or hypothesis (statement of purpose).

item.title: Thesis Tasks
item.description: Define the problem: with the topic description as starting point, you need to describe in more detail what the problems are or what the product is. You also need to motivate the work and say why it is important that it should be done.

item.title: State of the Art
item.description: Existing research into the Roborock by Dennie Giese (2019) Allowed the expansion for custom software firmware (DustCloud, Valetudo, RRoR) Roborock Founded in 2014 https://roborock.com.au/pages/about-us Partnered with Xiaomi (investor) Developed the Xiaomi Mi Robot along with other devices Have since been also releasing their own products Partnership -> Uses the Xiaomi Protocol RE Alexa, Google Assistant, Siri

item.title: Points of Contact
item.description: Wireless Device Pairing When pairing the device over WiFi (for initial setup), the device acts as a wireless AP and hosts a wireless network roborock-***. Using a smartphone (with the Mi Home app) we can connect to this network, in order to transfer the configuration data.

item.title: Capturing Network Activity (Securely)
item.description: In order to better understand what the vacuum cleaner is doing, I need to figure out what the vacuum cleaner is both sending and receiving! This means that I will need to do some packet capturing, to get the TCP / UDP / etc… packets; but what’s the best (and budget-friendly) way to do that?
